H0.text: Transverse waves are the other waves that earthquakes cause in addition to longitudinal waves.

H1.text: Aural waves are the other waves that earthquakes cause in addition to longitudinal waves.

H2.text: Irregular waves are also produced by earthquakes, along with longitudinal waves.

H3.text: Electromagnetic waves are also caused by earthquakes, in addition to longitudinal waves.

A4.text: Secondary waves (S waves) are transverse in nature and arrive at seismograph stations after the faster-moving P waves
